Class L3Host

  • java.lang.Object
    • L3Host
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    L3Listener

    public class L3Host
extends java.lang.Object
implements L3Listener
    This class represents a host with 1 or more interfaces. Packets received on one interface are not routed to other interfaces.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      L3Host(java.lang.String hostname)
      Just store the given hostname in an instance variable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • L3Host

        public L3Host(java.lang.String hostname)
        Just store the given hostname in an instance variable.

    • Method Detail

      • addL3Iface

        public void addL3Iface(L3Iface iface)
        add an L3Iface to this router, so that the router can route to/from it. Store the iface in our internal list of interfaces, and make this object a listener for packets from that interface. Also, add a direct route to the routing table.

      • packetReceived

        public void packetReceived(L3Handler handler,
                           L3Packet pkt)
        Called when this interface receives a packet from the network. Doesn't do anything except pass it on to a registered L3Listener.
        Specified by:
        packetReceived in interface L3Listener

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String bits,
                 L3Address dest)
        Send the given bits to the given destination address. Run this dest through the routing table to get the next-hop address and outgoing interface. Check if the routing table entry is for a directly connected network (isLocal is true). If so, use the dest as the nextHop. Create an L3Packet from the bits and pass down to the L3Iface from the routing table entry to send() the packet.

      • setListener

        public void setListener(L3Listener l)

      • getIface

        public L3Iface getIface()
        Just return the interface object.

      • addDefaultRoute

        public void addDefaultRoute(L3Address nextHop)
        add/update the default route to use the given nextHop.

      • addDefaultRoute

        public void addDefaultRoute(java.lang.String nextHopDottedDecimal)
        add/update the default route to use the given nextHop.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        return the hostname of this host.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
